function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Wearable devices may lead to false alarms or misdiagnosis of COVID-19 symptoms, leading to unnecessary panic or burden on healthcare systems.","Impact":"Increased anxiety and stress for individuals, potential strain on healthcare resources.","Mitigation":"Implement rigorous validation and calibration processes for wearable technology, provide clear guidance on interpretation of data, and encourage consultation with healthcare professionals.","Technologies":"Machine learning algorithms for pattern recognition, data analytics for validation, and communication interfaces for healthcare providers.","People":"Individuals using wearables for health monitoring, healthcare professionals, healthcare systems.","Owner":"Wearable technology manufacturers, healthcare providers, regulatory bodies."},{"Description":"Wearable devices collecting and transmitting health data may pose privacy and security risks, potentially leading to unauthorized access or misuse of sensitive personal information.","Impact":"Compromised privacy, identity theft, discrimination, and misuse of personal health information.","Mitigation":"Implement strong encryption and data security measures, obtain informed consent from users, comply with data protection regulations, and provide transparency in data usage.","Technologies":"End-to-end encryption, blockchain for data integrity, secure communication protocols, and privacy-preserving data analytics.","People":"Individuals using wearables for health monitoring, data protection authorities, cybersecurity experts.","Owner":"Wearable technology manufacturers, data protection authorities, cybersecurity firms."},{"Description":"Dependence on wearables for health monitoring may lead to neglect of traditional healthcare practices and face-to-face medical consultations, resulting in delayed or inadequate medical care for non-COVID-19 related conditions.","Impact":"Prolonged illnesses, worsening of chronic conditions, and reduced access to essential medical interventions.","Mitigation":"Emphasize the complementary role of wearables alongside traditional healthcare, promote regular medical check-ups, and provide education on the limitations of wearable technology.","Technologies":"Telemedicine platforms, remote monitoring interfaces, and integrated health data systems.","People":"Individuals relying on wearables for health monitoring, healthcare professionals, individuals with chronic illnesses.","Owner":"Healthcare providers, public health authorities, wearable technology manufacturers."}]}
